CategoryNote: Free and Open Source software (FOSS) that works on Linux (may also have builds for other platforms but aren’t guaranteed. Check the Wikipedia article and/or website if unsure). Many of these would be available in the official software repositories of your distribution, the links are provided for your information and research.
Name: LibreOffice
Pidgin
Note: Connects to various protocols

Name: Telegram
Note: Server side isn’t Open Source

Name: Wire
Note: Server side isn’t Open Source

Name: Mattermost
Note: Project chat designed for technical teams

Name: Banshee
Note: Not updated in a while but still works

Name: Ardour
Note: For advanced use

Name: Gnome Sound Recorder
Note: Basic, recording only

Name: spotify-qt
Note: Open source unofficial Spotify client

Name: Opensource.com
Note: Funded by Red hat so slightly biased towards that

Name: Linux.com
Note: From the Linux Foundation

Name: Linux Lads
Note: Loosely affiliated with our Linux Community

Name: Jupiter Broadcasting
Note: For Linux Unplugged, Self-Hosted, Linux Action News and Coder Radio

Name: Destination LInux Network
Note: For Destination Linux, Hardware Addicts, This Week in Linux and DLN Xtend

Name: Steam
Note: Probably the most supported platform, a lot of DRM games

Name: protondb
Note: List of Windows games working on Linux under project Proton

Name: GOG
Note: DRM free, good Linux selection and quite a bit of old Windows games that run very well under Wine

Name: itch.io
Note: open, indie gaming platform

Name: Humble Bundle
Note: Used to be really good, now occasionally good, has good DRM free support, now is owned by IGN

Name: Arch Wiki
Note: A very good resource even for other distributions, can be quite technical at times

Name: EDRI
Note: European Digital Rights

Name: Open Rights Group
Note: EFF’s sister organisation in the UK

Name: VideoLAN
Note: VLC mainly, but they do a lot of codec development too
